revision.text:
{{pp-semi-blp|small=yes}} {{Infobox person | name = Adam Sandler | image = Adam Sandler 2011 (Cropped).jpg | caption = Sandler receiving his star on the
[[Hollywood Walk of Fame]] in February 2011 | birth_name = Adam Richard Sandler | alias = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1966|9|9}} | birth_place = [[Brooklyn]], New York, U.S. | years_active = 1987–present{{cite book|author1=Geoffrey M. Horn|title=Adam Sandler|date=2006|publisher=Gareth Stevens|isbn=0836842340|page=17|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=PY35LJZklJkC&pg=PA17&lpg=PA17&dq=adam+sandler+1987+cosby+show&source=bl&ots=ej9ZydMoky&sig=_F5cAXkd5creLp4G7LxyVil74qE&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwif7oqXqM3aAhVEEpAKHcw4CNYQ6AEIiwEwEA#v=onepage&q=adam%20sandler%201987%20cosby%20show&f=false|accessdate=April 22, 2018}} | occupation = {{Flat list| *Actor *comedian *[[screenwriter]] *film producer *musician}} | alma_mater = [[Tisch School of the Arts]] | party = | spouse = {{marriage|Jacqueline Titone|2003}} | children = 2 | signature = | module = {{Infobox comedian|embed=yes | medium = [[Stand-up comedy|Stand-up]], [[film]], [[television]] | genre = | website = {{url|adamsandler.com}} }} }} '''Adam Richard Sandler''' (born September 9, 1966) is an American actor, comedian, screenwriter, and film producer. After becoming a ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' cast member, Sandler went on to star in many Hollywood feature films that combined have grossed over $2 billion at the box office.{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/people/?view=Actor&sort=sumgross&p=.htm |title=People Index |website=BoxOfficeMojo.com |accessdate=April 30, 2013}} He is best known for his roles in the films ''[[Billy Madison]]'' (1995), the sports comedies ''[[Happy Gilmore]]'' (1996) and ''[[The Waterboy]]'' (1998), the romantic comedy ''[[The Wedding Singer]]'' (1998), ''[[Big Daddy (1999 film)|Big Daddy]]'' (1999), and ''[[Mr. Deeds]]'' (2002), and voicing [[Count Dracula|Dracula]] in ''[[Hotel Transylvania]]'' (2012), ''[[Hotel Transylvania 2]]'' (2015), and ''[[Hotel Transylvania 3: Summer Vacation]]'' (2018). Several of his films, most notably the widely panned ''[[Jack and Jill (2011 film)|Jack and Jill]]'', have gained harsh criticism, culminating in a shared second place in the number of [[Raspberry Awards]] (3) and Raspberry Award nominations (11), in both cases second only to [[Sylvester Stallone]]. He has ventured into more dramatic territory with his roles in ''[[Punch-Drunk Love]]'' (2002), ''[[Spanglish (film)|Spanglish]]'' (2004), ''[[Reign Over Me]]'' (2007), ''[[Funny People]]'' (2009), and ''[[The Meyerowitz Stories]]'' (2017), all of which earned him critical praise.{{cite web|last=Cea|first=Max|url=https://www.salon.com/2017/10/12/noah-baumbach-performs-a-miracle-adam-sandler-doesnt-suck-in-the-meyerowitz-stories/|title=Noah Baumbach performs a miracle: Adam Sandler doesn’t suck in 'The Meyerowitz Stories''|work=[[Salon (website)|Salon]]|date=October 12, 2017|accessdate=April 28, 2017}} == Early life == Sandler was born in [[Brooklyn]], [[New York (state)|New York]] in 1966,{{cite news|title=Monitor|newspaper=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|date=September 13, 2013|issue=1276|pages=28}} to Judith "Judy" (née Levine), a nursery school teacher, and Stanley Sandler (1935-2003), an electrical engineer.{{cite web| url = http://www.filmreference.com/film/70/Adam-Sandler.html |title=Adam Sandler Biography (1966?-)| website= Film Reference.com|accessdate=December 24, 2014 | quote=Full name, Adam Richard Sandler; born September 9, 1966 (some sources cite 1964)...}} His family is [[Jews|Jewish]] and descends from Russian Jewish immigrants on both sides.{{Cite news|url=http://jewishjournal.com/opinion/rob_eshman/180474/|title=Adam Sandler: "I'm very pro-Israel"|last=Eshman|first=Rob|date=December 15, 2015|work=[[The Jewish Journal of Greater Los Angeles|Jewish Journal]]|accessdate=May 20, 2018|quote="I'm proud of being a Jew and that's what I am," Sandler said.}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/film/starsandstories/3709985/Adam-Sandler-this-ones-for-the-kids.html|title=Adam Sandler: this one's for the kids|last=Hiscock|first=John|date=December 11, 2008|work=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|accessdate=July 30, 2018}}{{cite news |url=http://www.tabletmag.com/scroll/196117/adam-sandler-and-howard-stern-talk-jewish-shop|title= Adam Sandler and Howard Stern Talk Jewish Shop |first=Jonathan |last=Zalman |work=[[Tablet (magazine)|Tablet Magazine]]|date= December 22, 2015|accessdate= April 18, 2018}}{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/films/features/i-didnt-get-into-movies-to-please-the-critics-adam-sandler-interview-8742294.html|title= 'I didn't get into movies to please the critics': Adam Sandler interview |work=[[The Independent]]|first=Emma |last=Jones |date= August 2, 2013|accessdate= April 18, 2018}}{{cite web|author=Галина Галкина |url=http://www.golos-ameriki.ru/content/just-go-with-it-2011-03-21-118361894/224464.html |title=Притворный брак Адама Сэндлера и Дженнифер Энистон |website=Golos-ameriki.ru |date=March 21, 2011 |accessdate=June 13, 2013}} He grew up in [[Manchester, New Hampshire]], after moving there at the age of six.{{cite web|url=http://www.unionleader.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/99999999/NEWHAMPSHIRE09/110429372/-1/newhampshire09|title=Adam Sandler|work=UnionLeader.com}} He attended [[Manchester Central High School]]. As a teen, Sandler was in [[BBYO]], a popular Jewish youth group. Sandler graduated from [[New York University]]'s [[Tisch School of the Arts]] in 1988.{{cite web| url= http://www.nyu.edu/alumni.magazine/issue10/10_culture_snl.html | title= Live From New York, It's... | publisher=[[New York University]] | work=NYU Alumni Magazine | date= Spring 2008 | accessdate=June 30, 2010| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100530061407/http://www.nyu.edu/alumni.magazine/issue10/10_culture_snl.html| archivedate= May 30, 2010 | deadurl= no}} == Career == === Acting career === [[File:Adamsandler(cannesPhotocall).jpg|thumb|Sandler at 2002 [[Cannes Film Festival]]]] Early in his career, in 1987, Sandler played [[Theo Huxtable]]'s friend, Smitty in ''[[The Cosby Show]]'' and the Stud Boy or Trivia Delinquent in the [[Game show|MTV game show]] ''[[Remote Control (game show)|Remote Control]]''. After his film debut ''[[Going Overboard]]'' in 1989, Sandler performed in comedy clubs, having first taken the stage at his brother's urging when he was 17. He was discovered by comedian [[Dennis Miller]], who caught Sandler's act in Los Angeles and recommended him to ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' producer [[Lorne Michaels]]. Sandler was hired as a writer for ''SNL'' in 1990 and became a featured player the following year, making a name for himself by performing amusing original songs on the show, including "[[The Thanksgiving Song]]" and "[[The Chanukah Song]]".{{cite web | url = http://www.biography.com/people/adam-sandler-9542505|title= Adam Sandler Biography: Film Actor, Singer, Songwriter, Comedian, Screenwriter (1966–)| website=Biography.com ([[A&E Networks]])| accessdate=December 24, 2014}} Sandler told [[Conan O'Brien]] on ''[[The Tonight Show with Conan O'Brien|The Tonight Show]]'' that [[NBC]] fired him and [[Chris Farley]] from the show in 1995.{{cite news| url = http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/2010/01/21/2010-01-21_youre_not_alone_conan_obrien_adam_sandler_says_nbc_fired_him_and_chris_farley_fr.html | title= You're not alone, Conan O'Brien: Adam Sandler says NBC fired him and Chris Farley from 'SNL'| first= Joe |last=Dziemianowicz| work=[[Daily News (New York)|Daily News]] | location=New York City |date= January 21, 2010}} In 1993, Adam Sandler appeared in the film ''[[Coneheads (film)|Coneheads]]'' with Chris Farley, [[David Spade]], [[Dan Aykroyd]], [[Phil Hartman]], and [[Jane Curtin]]. In 1994, he co-starred in ''[[Airheads]]'' with [[Brendan Fraser]] and [[Steve Buscemi]]. He starred in ''[[Billy Madison]]'' (1995) playing a grown man repeating grades 1–12 to earn back his father's respect and the right to inherit his father's multimillion-dollar hotel empire; the film received negative reviews. He followed this film with ''[[Bulletproof (1996 film)|Bulletproof]]'' (1996), and the financially successful comedies ''Happy Gilmore'' (1996) and ''The Wedding Singer'' (1998). He was initially cast in the bachelor-party-themed comedy/thriller ''[[Very Bad Things]]'' (1998) but had to back out due to his involvement in ''[[The Waterboy]]'' (1998), one of his first hits. Although his earliest films did not receive critical praise, he started to receive more positive reviews, beginning with ''Punch-Drunk Love'' in 2002. [[Roger Ebert]]'s review of ''Punch-Drunk Love'' concluded that Sandler had been wasted in earlier films with poorly written scripts and characters with no development.Ebert, Roger. [http://rogerebert.suntimes.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20021018/REVIEWS/210180308/1023 "Punch-Drunk Love."] ''Chicago Sun-Times''. October 18, 2002. Sandler has moved outside the genre of slapstick comedy to take on more serious parts such as the aforementioned ''[[Punch-Drunk Love]]'' (for which he was nominated for a [[Golden Globe]]) and [[Mike Binder]]'s ''[[Reign Over Me]]'' (2007), a drama about a man who loses his entire family in [[9/11]] and rekindles a friendship with his old college roommate ([[Don Cheadle]]). He starred alongside friend [[Kevin James]] in the film ''[[I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry]]'' (2007), and headlined ''[[You Don't Mess with the Zohan]]'' (2008). The film was written by Sandler, [[Judd Apatow]], and [[Robert Smigel]], and it was directed by [[Dennis Dugan]]. [[File:Adam Sandler 6818.jpg|thumb|left|Sandler in [[Berlin]] 2009]] Sandler starred along with [[Keri Russell]] and English comedian [[Russell Brand]] in [[Adam Shankman]]'s fantasy film ''[[Bedtime Stories (film)|Bedtime Stories]]'' (2008), as a stressed hotel maintenance worker whose bedtime stories he reads to his niece and nephew begin to come true. It marked as Sandler's first family film and first film under the [[The Walt Disney Company|Walt Disney]] banner.{{cite web| url = http://www.comingsoon.net/news/movienews.php?id=19719 |title=Adam Sandler's Bedtime Stories Come True| website=ComingSoon.net | date= April 4, 2007}} In 2009, Sandler starred in Judd Apatow's third directorial feature ''[[Funny People]]''. The film was released on July 31, 2009.{{cite news | author=Michael Fleming | title = Trio joins Judd Apatow film |work=Variety | date = June 11, 2008 | url = http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117987337.html?categoryid=13&cs=1 | accessdate=June 13, 2008| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20080709034441/http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117987337.html?categoryid=13&cs=1| archivedate=July 9, 2008| deadurl= no}} Following the release of ''Funny People'', it, along with ''Punch-Drunk Love'' were cited in the June 2010 announcement that Sandler was one of 135 people (including 20 actors) invited to join the [[Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences]].{{cite web| url= http://www.oscars.org/press/pressreleases/2010/20100625.html | title= Academy Invites 135 to Membership | publisher=[[Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences]] | work=[[Press release]] | date= June 25, 2010 | location= Beverly Hills, CA | accessdate=June 29, 2010| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100630164148/http://www.oscars.org/press/pressreleases/2010/20100625.html| archivedate= June 30, 2010 | deadurl= no}} Sandler appeared in ''[[Grown Ups (film)|Grown Ups]]'', alongside Kevin James, [[Chris Rock]], [[Rob Schneider]], and David Spade. Sandler and ''Dickie Roberts'' scribe Fred Wolf wrote the script and Dennis Dugan directed the film.{{cite news| url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117999951.html?categoryid=13&cs=1 | title = Columbia pic gets Sandler and friends |work=Variety | date = February 10, 2009 | accessdate=February 12, 2009 | first=Tatiana | last=Siegel| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090213130229/http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117999951.html?categoryid=13&cs=1| archivedate= February 13, 2009 | deadurl= no}} Sandler starred with [[Jennifer Aniston]] in the 2011 romantic comedy film ''[[Just Go with It]]''. Sandler also voiced a capuchin monkey in Kevin James's ''[[Zookeeper (film)|Zookeeper]]'', released on July 8, 2011.{{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1222817/|title=Zookeeper (2011)|author=Stephen Cook|date=July 8, 2011|work=IMDb}} In 2012, he starred in ''[[That's My Boy (2012 film)|That's My Boy]]'', as a man who fathered a son ([[Andy Samberg]]) with his teacher in high school. Sandler starred with [[Drew Barrymore]] in the [[Warner Bros.]] romantic comedy ''[[Blended (film)|Blended]]'', which was filmed in [[South Africa]], and was released on May 23, 2014. In 2013, he guest starred in the [[Disney Channel Original Series]] ''[[Jessie (2011 TV series)|Jessie]]'' as himself. He and [[Cameron Boyce]] previously worked together in ''Grown Ups'' and ''[[Grown Ups 2]]''. The episode is titled "Punched Dumped Love". Sandler co-starred in the drama film ''[[Men, Women & Children (film)|Men, Women & Children]]'' (2014), directed by [[Jason Reitman]].{{cite news|title=Toronto: Jason Reitman Lining Up His Next Film|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/toronto-jason-reitman-lining-up-620958|accessdate=19 December 2013|newspaper=hollywoodreporter.com|date=4 September 2013}}{{cite news|last=Pictures|first=Paramount|title=Production Begins on Jason Reitman's Men, Women & Children|url=http://www.comingsoon.net/news/movienews.php?id=112527|accessdate=19 December 2013|newspaper=comingsoon.net|date=16 December 2013}} He was considered for the voice of Rocket Raccoon in Marvel's ''[[Guardians of the Galaxy]]'' but [[Bradley Cooper]] was cast instead.{{cite web | url=http://www.ifc.com/2013/01/jim-carrey-adam-sandler-guardians-of-the-galaxy| work=IFC | title= Jim Carrey and Adam Sandler Being Considered For "Guardians of the Galaxy"| accessdate=October 10, 2016}} Sandler's recent comedy films, including ''Grown Ups'' and ''Grown Ups 2'', have received strongly negative reviews.{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/grown-ups-2-best-lines-584676|title='Grown Ups 2': The Best Lines from the Worst Reviews|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |date=July 12, 2013|accessdate=May 27, 2016}} In reviewing the latter, critic Mark Olsen of ''[[The Los Angeles Times]]'' remarked that Sandler had become the antithesis of [[Judd Apatow]]; he was instead "the white [[Tyler Perry]]: smart enough to know better, savvy enough to do it anyway, lazy enough not to care."{{cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/movies/moviesnow/la-et-mn-grown-ups-2-review-20130712-story.html|title='Review: 'Grown Ups 2' refuses to leave the sandbox|work=The Los Angeles Times|date=July 11, 2013|accessdate=May 27, 2016}} In 2015, Sandler released his last theatrical film ''[[Pixels (2015 film)|Pixels]]'', based on French director Patrick Jean's [[Pixels (2010 film)|2010 short film of the same name]], before transitioning into a distribution deal with [[Netflix]]. His first original film for Netflix was the Western comedy film ''[[The Ridiculous 6]]''. Despite being universally panned by critics,{{cite web |url=http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/the_ridiculous_six/?search=Ridiculous%20six |title= The Ridiculous Six (2015) |website=Rotten Tomatoes |accessdate=December 15, 2015}} on January 6, 2016, it was announced by Netflix that the film had been viewed more times in 30 days than any other movie in Netflix history.[https://variety.com/2016/film/news/adam-sandlers-ridiculous-six-is-making-history-for-netflix-1201673572 Adam Sandler’s ‘Ridiculous Six’ Is Making History for Netflix] ''Variety.com''. He released three additional films on Netflix between 2016 and 2018: ''[[The Do-Over]]'', ''[[Sandy Wexler]]'' and ''[[The Week Of]]''. He returned to dramatic territory in 2017 with ''[[The Meyerowitz Stories]]'', with his performance receiving acclaim from critics.{{cite web|url=https://www.salon.com/2017/10/12/noah-baumbach-performs-a-miracle-adam-sandler-doesnt-suck-in-the-meyerowitz-stories/|title=Noah Baumbach performs a miracle: Adam Sandler doesn't suck in "The Meyerowitz Stories"|work=[[Salon (website)|Salon]]|date=October 12, 2017|accessdate=October 14, 2017}} === Happy Madison Productions === [[File:Adam Sandler (cropped).jpg|thumb|Sandler at a press conference for ''[[Click (2006 film)|Click]]'' in 2005]] Sandler formed his film production company, [[Happy Madison Productions]],[http://www.adamsandler.com/index.php?section=happy "Happy Madison."] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20051118222008/http://www.adamsandler.com/index.php?section=happy |date=November 18, 2005 }} AdamSandler.com. Accessed October 9, 2008. in 1999, first producing fellow ''SNL'' alumnus [[Rob Schneider]]'s film ''[[Deuce Bigalow: Male Gigolo]]''. The company has produced most of Sandler's subsequent films to date. The majority of the company's films have received negative reviews from critics, with three considered to be among the [[List of films considered the worst|worst ever made]][http://www.metacritic.com/feature/adam-sandler-all-films-considered Adam Sandler: All Films Considered] Metacritic. Accessed April 21, 2015. yet most have performed well at box office. Others who frequently appear in Sandler films include [[David Spade]], [[Kevin James]], [[Steve Buscemi]], [[Chris Rock]], [[John Turturro]], [[Peter Dante]], [[Allen Covert]], [[Jonathan Loughran]], and [[Jon Lovitz]]. In 2014, Netflix announced a four-movie deal with Adam Sandler and Happy Madison Productions.{{Cite web|title = With Four New Adam Sandler Films, Netflix Takes Aim at Theaters - NYTimes.com|url = http://mobile.nytimes.com/2014/10/02/business/media/with-four-new-adam-sandler-films-netflix-takes-aim-at-theaters.html?ref=media&_r=0&referrer=|website = mobile.nytimes.com|accessdate = 2015-12-13}} The company is located on the Sony/[[Columbia Pictures]] lot in [[Culver City, California]]. ==Public image== Sandler has been referenced multiple times in various media, including in the TV shows ''[[The Simpsons]]'' in the episode "[[Monty Can't Buy Me Love]]",{{Cite web|url=http://bbc.adactio.com/cult/simpsons/episodeguide/season10/page20.shtml|title=Monty Can't Buy Me|website=[[BBC Online]]|date=September 2005|access-date=August 11, 2017}} in ''[[Family Guy]]'' in the episode "[[Stew-Roids]]",{{Cite web|url=http://ign.com/articles/2009/04/27/family-guy-stew-roids-review|title=Family Guy: "Stew-Roids" Review|website=[[IGN]]|first=Ahsan|last=Haque|date=April 27, 2009|access-date=August 11, 2017}} and in ''[[South Park]]'' in the episode "[[You're Getting Old]]".{{Cite web|url=http://entertainment.time.com/2011/06/09/south-park-watch-the-tao-of-poo/|title=South Park Watch: The Tao of Poo|work=[[Time (magazine)|Time]] |first=James|last=Poniewozik|date=June 9, 2011|access-date=August 11, 2017}} He was also referenced in the video game ''[[Half-Life: Opposing Force]]''.{{Cite web|url=https://www.vgfacts.com/trivia/6729/|title=Half-Life: Opposing Force|website=[[Did You Know Gaming?#VGFacts|VGFacts]]|author=RetroRex|access-date=August 11, 2017|quote=There is a hidden message on the upper skybox texture in the V-22 osprey g-man sequence. It reads "HACK HACK HACK ALL DAY LONG. HACK HACK HACK WHILE I SING THIS SONG". This is a reference to the Adam Sandler song "The Beating Of A High School Janitor.}} ==Personal life== On June 22, 2003, Sandler married actress Jacqueline Titone. Titone had [[Conversion to Judaism|converted]] to Sandler's religion, Judaism, in 2000.{{cite web|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/archives/nydn-features/numbers-drew-adam-article-1.643235 |title=By The Numbers Drew & Adam |work=NY Daily News |date=February 17, 2004 |accessdate=January 29, 2013}}{{cite web|last=Wihlborg |first=Ulrica |url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,1191818,00.html |title=Adam Sandler, Wife Have a Baby |work=People |date=May 7, 2006 |accessdate=January 28, 2013}} She makes frequent appearances in her husband's Happy Madison films. The couple have two daughters: Sadie (born 2006)[http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,1191818,00.html "Adam Sandler, Wife Have a Baby."] ''People.com''. and Sunny (born 2008).[https://www.reuters.com/article/domesticNews/idUSTRE4AB18Q20081112 "Adam Sandler and wife have second daughter."] Reuters.com. November 12, 2008. In 2007, Sandler made a $1 million donation to the [[Boys & Girls Clubs of America|Boys & Girls Club]] in his hometown, [[Manchester, New Hampshire|Manchester]], New Hampshire.[http://www.newhampshire.com/nh-people/adam-sandler-biography.aspx "Adam Sandler donates $1 million to Manchester charity."] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100818203545/http://www.newhampshire.com/nh-people/adam-sandler-biography.aspx |date=August 18, 2010 }} newhampshire.com. The same year, he donated $2,100 to former [[New York City]] [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] mayor [[Rudy Giuliani presidential campaign, 2008|Rudy Giuliani's presidential campaign]]. Sandler is now believed to be an [[Independent voter|independent]], and has not made his political views known since his donation to Giuliani's campaign in 2007. Sandler resides in his main residence in [[Los Angeles]], California, and has a second residence in the same condominium building his mother resides in [[Highland Beach, Florida]]. == Filmography == ''This is a partial list of Sandler's film work. For the complete list, see [[Adam Sandler filmography]].'' {{columns-list|colwidth=22em| * ''[[Billy Madison]]'' (1995) * ''[[Happy Gilmore]]'' (1996) * ''[[The Wedding Singer]]'' (1998) * ''[[The Waterboy]]'' (1998) * ''[[Big Daddy (1999 film)|Big Daddy]]'' (1999) * ''[[Little Nicky]]'' (2000) * ''[[Punch-Drunk Love]]'' (2002) * ''[[Anger Management (film)|Anger Management]]'' (2003) * ''[[50 First Dates]]'' (2004) * ''[[The Longest Yard (2005 film)|The Longest Yard]]'' (2005) * ''[[Click (2006 film)|Click]]'' (2006) * ''[[Reign Over Me]]'' (2007) * ''[[I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry]]'' (2007) * ''[[You Don't Mess with the Zohan]]'' (2008) * ''[[Grown Ups (film)|Grown Ups]]'' (2010) * ''[[Jack and Jill (2011 film)|Jack and Jill]]'' (2011) * ''[[Hotel Transylvania]]'' (2012) * ''[[Grown Ups 2]]'' (2013) * ''[[Pixels (2015 film)|Pixels]]'' (2015) * ''[[Hotel Transylvania 2]]'' (2015) * ''[[The Ridiculous 6]]'' (2015) * ''[[The Meyerowitz Stories|The Meyerowitz Stories (New and Selected)]]'' (2017) * ''[[Hotel Transylvania 3: Summer Vacation]]'' (2018) * ''[[Murder Mystery (film)|Murder Mystery]]'' (2019) }} == Discography == [[File:Adam Sandler footprint.jpg|thumb|Sandler's handprints and shoeprints in front of [[Grauman's Chinese Theatre]], 2008]] ;Studio albums {| class="wikitable" |- ! Year ! Title ! Certification |- | 1993 |''[[They're All Gonna Laugh at You!]]'' | 2× Platinum{{cite web|url=https://www.riaa.com/goldandplatinumdata.php?artist=Sandler+Adam|title=RIAA - Gold & Platinum - Sandler, Adam|publisher=[[Recording Industry Association of America]]|accessdate=April 4, 2014}} |- | 1996 |''[[What the Hell Happened to Me?]]'' | 2× Platinum |- | 1997 |''[[What's Your Name?]]'' | Gold |- | 1999 |''[[Stan and Judy's Kid]]'' | Gold |- | 2004 |''[[Shhh...Don't Tell]]'' | |} ==Awards and nominations== {{main|List of awards and nominations received by Adam Sandler}} == References ==
